Data Protection Efficiency

Tools such as deduplication and compression have helped organizations consume less space. Cohesity builds on these tools and implements the technology differently than traditional vendors. As a result, the same amount of data requires less space to be stored on Cohesity DataPlatform.
Current Environment

attributes.style: border: none; padding: 0; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 700; height: 22px;

children.html: How many front-end (source) TBs are you currently protecting in ?

attributes.title: Front-end TBs, also commonly referred to as a "source TBs" are the total amount of data to be ingested by Cohesity for the purpose of backups. This is commonly the source input TBs used in our web-sizing tool and drives our Cost per Protected TB benefit.

children.html: How many back-end TBs are you currently storing in ?

attributes.title: Back-end TBs are the amount of stored TBs in the customer's current environment after deduplicaton and compression. This drives our storage efficiency gains.

attributes.style: border: none; padding: 0; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 700; height: 22px;

children.html: How many front-end (source) TBs are you currently protecting in (if any)?

attributes.title: This datacenter is commonly used to account for any additional DR software or additional front-end TBs where source data is protected in multiple datacenters

children.html: How many back-end TBs are you currently storing in (if any)?

attributes.title: It is not uncommon for customers to have different retention periods for different datacenters. Use this field to account for any additional retention copies being stored.

children.html: ADDITIONAL QUESTIONS
How many years do you want to analyze over?
What is your Annual Growth Rate %?
What % of your data is VMs, Home Directories and other data that deduplicates well

attributes.title: This data is used to drive our deduplication efficiency. Data such as databases do NOT deduplicate well, but other data like VMs and user Home Directories do. Estimate the % of back-end TBs that should deduplicate well.

children.html: What % of your data is compressed video and image files

attributes.title: This data is used to drive our compression efficiency. Data such as compressed video and image files typically do NOT compress well. Data such as databases however typically compress very well, as long as they are not pre-compressed or encrypted by the source prior to backup. Estimate the % of back-end TBs that will NOT compress well.

children.html: Operational Efficiency

Operational efficiency is compromised by the need to manage multiple proprietary systems with different UIs, where each may require specialist administrators. Cohesity simplifies operations through the use of easy and intuitive policy administration through a single pane of glass providing a plug-and-play experience for managing daily operations.
Labor Cost Metrics
Number of employees managing your current solution
Average salary per FTE
Salary load factor(%) (Cost of benefits, etc. Typically 30-35%)
Total salary cost of FTEs managing current solution

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown

children.html: FTE Total Available Hours (based on 2,080 working hours / year / FTE)

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown

children.html: What % of available hours are spent on tasks not related to managing the solution (other projects, corporate activities, other...)
Total hours spent on managing existing solution

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown

children.html: Resource Allocation for Operations
What % of the hours are spent on Operations

attributes.title: Operations accounts for common tasks such as: agent-related activities, proxy server setup and management, backup management, recovery management, and more. This is currently estimated at 50% and will be updated based on market research from Forrester. This number can be adjusted based on customer feedback.

children.html: What % of the hours are spent on Troubleshooting

attributes.title: Troubleshooting accounts for tasks such as: failed backups, support engagement, elimination of log silos (master, media and storage logs), and more. This is currently estimated at 30% and will be updated based on market research from Forrester. This number can be adjusted based on customer feedback

children.html: What % of the hours are spent on Legal & Compliance

attributes.title: Legal & Compliance accounts for tasks such as: global search, global content scanning, simplified legal hold, vulnerability scanning and more. This is calculated and the remainder of time leftover after Operations and Troubleshooting is accounted for.

children.html: Risk & Compliance

Cohesity takes a multi-layered security approach to prevent, detect, and analyze threats. Customers can take advantage of native cybersecurity features such as Immutable file system, software encryption, over the wire encryption, multi-factor authentication, DataLock (WORM) to protect their data. In addition, Cohesity DataPlatform is capable of conducting user and behavior analytics for security and compliance reasons.
Ransomware
How much do you expect to pay for the ransom? (Avg ransom = $84,000)
What is your estimated cost of downtime per day? (revenue loss, employee productivity loss, brand/reputation risk, etc)
How long do you expect you will be down if you pay the ransom? (Avg outage = 7 days)
Cost of recovery via ransomware payments and decryption

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown

children.html: How long do you expect you will be down if you restore using your current backup solution?
What is the risk that your current backup implementation will be unusable for recovery?

attributes.title: Is the customer currently using WORM technology and/or multi-factor authentication? Are the backups running on a Windows OS which is more susceptible to vulnerabilities? These all impact their ability to recover data from the existing backup implementation.
